page.title: 19THE NATIONAL TRUST 2
page.content: OLDEST HOUSE l577-gable faces Mercat Cross. HOUSE WITH GREEK INSCRIPTION "God provides and will provide" near Mercat Cross. BUTCHER'S HOUSE-Tan- house Brae. Trade plate alongside IS/ IL l664. RUINS OF ST.MUNGO'S CHAPEL l5O3 - on road east out of village, built to commemorate Mungo's birth- place.THE NUNNERY-in Wee Causeway-name from veiled head on skewput.Outside stair.BISHOP LEIGHTON'S HOUSE-in Mid Causeway.THE ARK-adjoining Nunnery-was seaman's hostel.TOWNHOUSE l626-domin- ates Sandhaven. Frontage and tower added l783.Was on edge of harbour. Council Chambers-first floor.Ceiling- in original state- of Dutch origin, as is Aumrie or Dutch cupboard.Both have similar designs(faces,etc,).Standard measures,peck,yardstick,etc.,kept here.Debtors room opposite.Stair up to turret where local witches confined.
